query: Give me an overview of the egress plan.
response:
### Egress plan overview (Sheet **A000**, Detail **1**)

**What it’s showing**
- **Primary egress/accessible paths** are the **gray shaded routes with arrows**. These are called out as a **“36" MINIMUM CLEAR ACCESSIBLE ROUTE”** per the legend. (Sheet **A000**)
- **Exit signage locations** are tagged with the circle/quartered symbol:
  - **Existing exit sign** = circle with right quadrant filled.  
  - **New directional exit sign at Drive Thru Cockpit** = circle with bottom quadrant filled. (Sheet **A000**, Legend)

**Key distances called out**
- Travel distance noted across the (E) Kitchen: **60'-9 1/2"** (Sheet **A000**, Egress Plan)
- Segment near Pick-Up area: **21'-0 1/2"** (Sheet **A000**, Egress Plan)

**Areas impacted (so watch egress continuity during phasing)**
- **New/added areas:** *(N) FREEZER*, *(N) OFFICE*, **NEW CATERING AREA** (Sheet **A000**)
- **Modified:** **MODIFIED DRIVE THRU**, *(MODIFIED) COOLER*, **MODIFIED SERVING AREA** (Sheet **A000**)
- **Existing spaces called out:** *(E) KITCHEN*, *(E) HALLWAY*, *(E) RESTROOM* (3), *(E) OFFICE*, *(E) SERVICE YARD* (Sheet **A000**)

### Accessibility/egress items to enforce in the field (Sheet **A000**, “Accessibility Notes”)
- **Accessible route cross-slope:** **2% max**.
- **Egress/accessible route clear width:** **36" min** (from legend).
- **Panic hardware height:** **46" A.F.F. max**.
- **Public controls/switches:** **48" A.F.F. max** (U.N.O.).
- **Floor transitions/thresholds:** **1/2" max** with bevel **1:2 max slope**.
- **Kitchen floor drains:** keep **out of path of travel**; slope along accessible route **≤ 2%**.

### Coordination flags
- **Exit sign work**: A000 shows new vs existing, but the **electrical sheet(s)** should confirm circuits/fixture types—wasn’t explicitly found by keyword search, so we should verify on E sheets. (Sheet **A000** + needs E-sheet check)
- **Canopy interface:** A000 references **AS2.1** (OMD canopy). Make sure canopy work doesn’t reduce the **36" min** route or create headroom conflicts. (Sheets **A000**, **AS2.1**)

If you tell me which exit doors you’re most concerned about (front entry, kitchen/service yard, etc.), I can pull the exact door tags and cross-check against the door schedule (Sheet **A801**) and the floor plan (Sheet **A101**).

query: What's getting demolished on the demolition RCP?
response:
On **A002 – Demolition RCP**, the demo scope is pretty limited; most ceiling/exterior elements are called out to **remain and be protected**.

**Items getting removed / relocated (per Legend/Notes on A002):**
- **Existing fans & heaters: RELOCATE** to the new exterior patio seating area (**Note 8**, Rev cloud “A”). *(A002)*
- **Existing LED light(s): REMOVE** where the “existing LED light to be removed” symbol is tagged on the plan. *(A002 – see Legend + the fixture tags on the RCP plan)*

**Items specifically called out to remain (protect in place):**
- **Existing exterior soffit: REMAIN** — contractor to protect (**Note 5**). *(A002)*
- **Existing canopy: REMAIN** — contractor to protect (**Note 6**). *(A002)*
- **Existing air curtain: REMAIN** (**Note 7**, Rev cloud “A”). *(A002)*
- **Existing LED lights: REMAIN** where shown with the “existing LED light to remain” symbol. *(A002)*
- **Existing exit lights: REMAIN U.N.O.** *(A002)*

**General note that affects demo:** “**All existing ceilings are to remain unless noted otherwise (U.N.O.)**.” *(A002 – RCP General Notes)*

**Coordination flag:** The plan uses symbols/keyed tags to indicate *which specific* LED fixtures are removed vs remain—make sure electrical/MEP is aligned on disconnects and re-feed for anything being relocated/removed. *(A002)*

query: What are the travel distances on the egress plan?
response:
On the **Egress Plan – Sheet A000**:

- **60'-9 1/2"** travel distance noted diagonally across the **(E) Kitchen**. *(Sheet A000)*
- **21'-0 1/2"** travel distance noted on a vertical segment near the **Pick-Up area**. *(Sheet A000)*

If you tell me which room/area you’re checking (dining, office, freezer, etc.), I can confirm whether there are any other travel distance callouts on A000 beyond these two.

query: What door hardware sets are specified in the door schedule?
response:
Door hardware sets called out in the schedules are:

- **Set #1 – Storefront Entry** (YKK or Kawneer option) — **A801**  
- **Set #05 – Dining Exit-Only (Single)** (YKK or Kawneer option) — **A801**  
- **Set #09 – Office** (Locknet or DH Pace option) — **A801**

Coordination note: Door Schedule ties **Doors 2 & 3 = Set #1** and **Door 4 = Set #05** on **A801**. (Door 1 is a Tormax system and defers to shop drawings rather than a set.)

query: What type of roof system is specified?
response:
Roof is a **Duro-Last single-ply membrane system** — called out as **“Duro-Last 50 mil single-ply membrane over 2” rigid (polyiso) insulation.”** *(Sheet **A102** – Roof Plan)*

Details confirm it as a **mechanically fastened Durolast white membrane roofing** with field-welded transitions and Durolast manufacturer detail references (ex: **#6061**, overflow scupper **#2060**, curb **#4020**). *(Sheet **A103** – Roof Details)*

Coordination flag: equipment curb flashing heights are **min 12" (exhaust fans)** and **min 14" (A/C units)**—make sure mech curbs match before roofer mobilizes. *(Sheet **A103**)*

query: What are the exterior wall materials shown on the elevations?
response:
On the **building exterior elevations (Sheet A301 – “Exterior Elevations”)** the wall materials shown/called out are:

- **Brick veneer (2 types):**  
  - **Brick #1: “Red Velour”** (Acme *Crimson* equivalent)  
  - **Brick #2: “Tan”** (Acme *Desert Tan* equivalent)  
  *(see A301 – brick specs/finish callouts)*

- **Fiber-cement panels/siding:** **James Hardie smooth finish** panels/siding shown on portions of the elevations *(A301 – “Hardie Soffits & Panels” notes and elevation hatching/callouts)*

- **Metal wall panel accent:** **Nichiha “Illumination Red”** metal panel *(A301 – Exterior Finishes & Colors)*

- **Storefront glazing system at openings:** **YKK YES 45 storefront, Dark Bronze** *(A301 – storefront material callout)*

Coordination flag: the elevations show transitions between these finishes—make sure those corner/transition details get built per the referenced wall section detail (ex: **1/A402 noted on A301**). If you tell me which elevation (SE/NW/SW/NE) you’re standing at, I can point to the exact callouts on that view.

query: What floor finishes are called out on A111?
response:
On **A111 (A111_Floor_Finish_Plan_p001)** the floor finishes called out are:

- **KT-1A (Kitchen Tile):** Creative Materials Corp., **Red 308**, **8" x 8"**; grout **G-3** with **3/8" joint**. *(A111 – Interior Finish Schedule region)*  
- **KT-1B:** Called out on the **Finish Plan** (tags shown in New Office / Catering areas), but the schedule text for KT-1B itself isn’t captured in the extracted schedule info I can see. *(A111 – Finish Plan region)*  
- **Floor grout callouts tied to floor tile types:**
  - **G-1:** Mapei **Ultra Color Grout**, **47 Charcoal** (used for **T-3 and T-4**). *(A111 – Interior Finish Schedule region)*  
  - **G-3:** Mapei **Kerapoxy IEG CQ**, **47 Charcoal** (used for **KT-1 series**). *(A111 – Interior Finish Schedule region)*

Coordination flag: **T-3 / T-4** are referenced for floor grout on **A111**, but the actual **T-3/T-4 floor finish descriptions** aren’t visible in the schedule extraction I have—so confirm those finish types on the sheet (or tell me what area you’re asking about and I’ll chase it across the specs/schedules).

query: Tell me about the refuse enclosure - what are the details?
response:
Refuse enclosure details are on **AS4.1** (plans/elevations) and **AS4.2** (sections/details/schedules).

## Layout + key dims (AS4.1 – Detail 1 “Refuse Enclosure Plan”)
- **Overall footprint:** **34'-0"** wide (exterior to exterior).  
- **Main refuse bay:** **26'-0"** wide (C/L to C/L) with **25'-4"** clear inside; **10'-0"** interior depth.  
- **Storage area:** **8'-0"** wide (ext. to C/L of partition); ~**7'-0"** inside (assuming 8" wall).  
- **Curb:** **6" high concrete curb** at interior perimeter of main refuse area.
- **Gates:** (4) gate sections @ **6'-4"** each.
- **Storage door opening:** **3'-8"** wide (Door 101); located **16"** off left exterior wall and **3'-0"** from partition (per plan notes).

## Walls/base/slab (AS4.2 – Detail 7 “Refuse Enclosure Base Detail” + Detail 9 “Section”)
- **CMU:** called out as **(N) 8" smooth face CMU** in section (**AS4.2/9**). Base detail shows **7-5/8" CMU** with **split-face** called out at exterior face areas (coord this finish intent) (**AS4.2/7**).
- **Grout:**  
  - **Bottom two courses solid grout (typ.)** (**AS4.2/7**)  
  - **Grout all cells with reinforcing solid** (**AS4.2/7**)  
  - Extend grout down into footing **per Structural** (**AS4.2/7**).
- **Expansion joints:** **1/2" expansion joint** at CMU-to-slab and CMU-to-finished grade (**AS4.2/7**).
- **Slab:** **4" concrete slab w/ reinforcing per Structural + 6 mil vapor barrier**; **sealed floor** (**AS4.2/9**).
- **Below grade:** **seal/waterproof CMU below grade prior to backfill** (**AS4.2/9**).

## Roof + drainage (AS4.1 – Detail 2 “Roof Plan” + AS4.2 – Detail 9 “Section”)
- **Roofing:** **White membrane roof** over storage portion; remainder labeled **OPEN** (**AS4.1/2**).
- **Deck/soffit:** **5/8" CDX plywood top deck**; **1/2" CDX soffit** painted to match adjacent (**AS4.2/9**).
- **Gutter/DS:** **(N) metal gutter** painted to match existing; **prefinished metal downspout dark bronze** (**AS4.2/9**).
- **Metal coping/parapet finish:** **Dark Bronze** (**AS4.1/2**, **AS4.2/9**).

## Gates + posts + hardware (AS4.2 – Detail 8 “Gate Rear View” + Detail 6 “Drop Rod” + AS4.1 plan)
- **Gate leaf width:** **6'-4"** each leaf/panel (**AS4.2/8**).
- **Gate height:** **8'-6"** from T.O. grade to top of gate/post (**AS4.2/8**).
- **Frame:** **2-1/2" x 2-1/2" steel tube** with diagonal brace (**AS4.2/8**).
- **Rails:** **1-1/2" x 1-1/2" steel angles** (**AS4.2/8**).
- **Infill:** **16 ga form deck panels**, welded to frame (**AS4.2/8**, **AS4.2/6**, **AS4.1 plan note**).
- **Posts:** **6" steel posts w/ caps (typ.)** (**AS4.1/1**, **AS4.2/8**).
- **Hinges:** collar hinges—**add grease fittings**, grease after painting (**AS4.2/8**).
- **Drop rod:** **1"Ø steel drop rod** w/ **6" guide sleeve**; provide **welded anti-theft tab** (**AS4.2/6**).
- **Receiver hole:** **1-1/4"Ø hole drilled in concrete drive** to receive drop rod (**AS4.2/6**, also noted on **AS4.1 plan**).

## Refuse pad tie-in to paving (AS4.2 – Detail 5)
- **Adjacent paving section:** **6" concrete paving over min 6" crushed stone base** (**AS4.2/5**) (civil may add more).
- **Joint:** **1/2" expansion joint** between refuse pad slab and concrete paving (**AS4.2/5**).
- **Edge:** **1" chamfered edge** at transition to expansion joint (**AS4.2/5**).
- **Termite control:** apply per **Spec C02361 under all concrete surfaces** (**AS4.2/5**).

## Storage room door / finishes (AS4.2 – Door & Finish Schedules)
- **Door 101:** **3'-8" x 7'-0" x 1-3/4"**, **Type 5 insulated hollow metal in welded HM frame**, finish **Dark Bronze (PT-113)** (**AS4.2 schedule**).
- **Louver:** **9"x9"** louver; bottom at **16" AFF** (**AS4.2 schedule**).
- **Hardware set #13:** includes piano hinge, lockset, lock guard, threshold, sweep, weatherstrip, closer, etc. (**AS4.2 schedule**).
- **Paint/finish key:** **PT-113 = Sherwin Williams Dark Bronze** used for “misc site metals” (gates/posts/coping called out dark bronze) (**AS4.2 schedule**, **AS4.1 roof plan**).

## Coordination flags (things to check before you pour/hang steel)
- **Footings/post foundations are “per Structural”** (gate post footing called out **26"Ø** on plan). I don’t have the actual footing depth/rebar here—needs the **S sheets** (**AS4.1/1**, **AS4.2/7**, **AS4.2/9**).
- **Civil grading/drainage:** slab/pad **slope to drain** references civil; make sure grade doesn’t bury CMU and that the expansion joint + paving section matches civil (**AS4.2/5**, **AS4.2 schedule note**).
- **Finish consistency:** section calls **smooth face CMU** but base detail references **split face**—confirm where each is intended so masonry sub doesn’t guess (**AS4.2/9** vs **AS4.2/7**).
- **Electrical:** lights shown as **GC-supplied/installed** but “refer to Electrical” for spec/location—needs E sheets to avoid missing conduit/stub-ups (**AS4.1 plan note**).

If you tell me what sheet you’re building off of (site plan vs these AS4 sheets) I can also pull the exact location on the site and any bollard/hydrant callouts tied to it.

query: What's the Tormax door detail on A401?
response:
On **A401**, the Tormax Drive-Thru door is shown in **Details 1–3**:

- **Detail 2/A401 – “DRIVE THRU TORMAX DOOR HEAD”**  
  - **B.O. HEADER = 7'-8" A.F.F.** (new built-up header under **existing steel angle**)  
  - **Recessed air curtain** at existing ceiling w/ **diverter box** below it (bottom of box flush w/ top of door opening / as low as possible without affecting door)  
  - **Backer rod + sealant** both sides at frame-to-header; **wood shims** as needed  
  - Notes call to coordinate air curtain location with **RCP + Mechanical** (and controller mounted above ceiling)

- **Detail 3/A401 – “DRIVE THRU TORMAX DOOR JAMB”**  
  - New Tormax door jamb tying into existing wall (brick/insulation/sheathing/framing)  
  - **Self-adhering membrane flashing** at the wall-to-frame transition  
  - **Shims** + **continuous backer rod & sealant** at **interior and exterior**  
  - Exterior **break metal** finish to match existing storefront; interior finish to match existing

- **Detail 1/A401 – “DRIVE THRU TORMAX DOOR SILL”** (3" = 1'-0")  
  - **Manufacturer threshold** on slab (“BY MFR.”)  
  - **Exterior slope max 2%** (needs civil grade/elev coordination)  
  - Track/anchor embed at slab edge shown—needs to be set during pour

Coordination flags: air curtain/diverter box can clash with door operators/sensors if set too low; and the **2% max slope at sill** needs to match the civil paving elevations so we don’t end up with water/ADA issues (even though it’s DT, it still matters for operation/drainage).
